run.name: Test Run 8/27/2024 - Registration via Google account

test.title: Sign in via via Google with a Personal Google Account

custom.preconds: The personal Google account being used for registration is not yet registered in the system.

step.content: Go to the registration page: https://appstruct.cloud/signup.
step.expected: The registration page should load correctly, displaying options for registering via email and social media accounts, including a "Sign in with Google" button.

step.content: Click on the "Sign in with Google" button.
step.expected: The system should redirect to the Google account selection or sign-in page.

step.content: Select my personal Google account yukasiitake@gmail.com from the list of accounts.
step.expected: The Google authentication process should complete, and the system should automatically retrieve necessary account information (e.g., email, name) from Google.

step.content: Observe the system's response after Google authentication.
step.expected: - The system should register the new user account using the information provided by Google. - A welcome message or confirmation screen should appear, indicating successful registration. - The user should be automatically logged into the application and redirected to the appropriate logged-in area (e.g., dashboard or homepage).

step.content: Verify that the user is logged in and has access to the account settings or profile page.
step.expected: - The account settings or profile page should display the correct information pulled from the Google account (e.g., email, name). - The user should have access to all functionalities available to newly registered users.

step.content: Go to the registration page: https://appstruct.cloud/signup.
step.expected: The registration page should load correctly, displaying options for registering via email and social media accounts, including a "Sign in with Google" button.

step.content: Click on the "Sign in with Google" button.
step.expected: The system should redirect to the Google account selection or sign-in page.

step.content: Select my personal Google account yukasiitake@gmail.com from the list of accounts.
step.expected: The Google authentication process should complete, and the system should automatically retrieve necessary account information (e.g., email, name) from Google.

step.content: Observe the system's response after Google authentication.
step.expected: - The system should register the new user account using the information provided by Google. - A welcome message or confirmation screen should appear, indicating successful registration. - The user should be automatically logged into the application and redirected to the appropriate logged-in area (e.g., dashboard or homepage).

step.content: Verify that the user is logged in and has access to the account settings or profile page.
step.expected: - The account settings or profile page should display the correct information pulled from the Google account (e.g., email, name). - The user should have access to all functionalities available to newly registered users.

custom.preconds: The user is logged into their account on the application.
custom.steps: Click the Sign Out button in the dropdown menu near the user icon in the top-right corner.
custom.expected: The user should log out and be redirected to the home page or login page.

change.comment:
The unlogging was successful. It took me to https://appstruct.cloud/login.
![](index.php?/attachments/get/3f1d9d15-379d-4c9f-bde5-697391320e4c)

test.title: Sing in via Google with an already registered account

custom.preconds: The user has already registered an account using the same email address via Google. Test data: account appstructusertest@gmail.com
custom.steps: 1. Go to the page https://appstruct.cloud/signup. 2. Click Sign in with Google and select the already registered Google account appstructusertest@gmail.com.
custom.expected: Registration is blocked, and an error message indicates the account is already registered.

change.comment: The system immediately lets the user into the service. Without checking if such an account already exists.
